intro: Ibadja walkeri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a low-growing shrub with thick, fleshy stems that store water. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Ibadja walkeri is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
